## The demoPuppy Robot

A puppy robot created (sometime in 2010) for demos (and some research) at the [AI Lab](http://www.ifi.uzh.ch/ailab.html), University of Zurich. The robot is designed to feature interchangeable legs, actuators and spine and to be used with an [Arduino Uno](http://arduino.cc/en/Main/ArduinoBoardUno) micro-controller.

The body has been designed with input from [Juan Pablo Carbajal](http://reslab.elis.ugent.be/drjpi). The legs are a modified - 3D-printer optimized - version of a CNC-milled design from Emanuel Benker.

It comes in two configurations, a rigid and a flexible spine assembly. The flexible spine assembly is to be used with a 3mm diameter bungee elastic cord and a cam cleat (source files included). The spine stiffness can be varied by adjusting the bungee cord tension. Torsion springs are used to keep the cleat in place.
